content: You are good at finding the object in a 3D scene based on a given query description.

These images show different views of a room. You need to find the chair in this query description: "the chair the right-most one on the northern side of the table. the chair is red with two arms.". 
Please review all view images to find the target object and select the view that you can see the target object most clearly. 
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys: 
"reasoning": Explain how you identified the target object, and why you choose this view.
"view": The number of the view is in the top left corner of the corresponding image. e.g., "view": "2"

The query describes a red chair with two arms located on the northern side of the table, specifically the right-most one. In the images, the northern side is the top side of the table. View 0 provides a clear top-down perspective, showing all chairs around the table. The right-most chair on the northern side is visible in this view, and it matches the description of being red with two arms.

Here is the annotated image of the selected view. 
All objects belonging to the chair class is labeled by a unique number (ID) in red color on it.
Please select the object ID that best matches the given query description: "the chair the right-most one on the northern side of the table. the chair is red with two arms.".
Carefully analyze the specified conditions (such as shape, color, relative position with surrounding objects) in the given query, then select top-5 best-matched object IDs.
The selected top-5 object IDs should be sorted in descending order of confidence.
The object ID should be chosen from this list [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 14, 17, 18, 19, 21, 22, 24, 26]
Output your answer in JSON format with these keys:

The red chairs on this side are labeled 24, 19, and 22. Among these, 22 is the right-most chair. Therefore, 22 is the best match. The other chairs on the northern side, 19 and 24, are also considered but are less likely to be the right-most.
